name: 1898 Waverly Inn

reviews.text: The ONLY criticism I have of this place is that the bathroom (at least the one I had) was little tight. The room I had (one the first floor) was HUGE.
reviews.title: Grand ol' Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read some of the other reviews and felt that I needed to come to the defense of the owners. Yes the Property is located on a busy street. I LIKE this (how many hotels are located right down town?) This is GOOD. It was a safe and pleasant walk to the center of town with some very cool shops.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hospitality, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The innkeepers were fun and laid back very talkative and informative.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I LIKED this place! I have stayed at many a Bed & Breakfast and this place is among the better ones. Some have been stuffy. Some one never sees the owner, some have gross "antique" (read used furniture) . This place was not like that and was plain old FUN.
reviews.title: A Great Stay!
The Waverly Inn is Wonderful!
reviews.text: The property itself is a little in need of TLC, but Not RUN DOWN. It is a beautiful example of a large southern home in the Asheville, NC area. (They are 1/2 hour away)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This inn provided a wonderfully relaxing get-away. The service was excellent with personal touch. The wine and cheese evening social and other snacks available at all times were nice. Breakfast was delicious, and the servers were very attentive. Our room as quaint and comfortable, with a very comfortable mattress. The large porches on both the first and second story provided a great place to sit and relax. It was a very short walk to downtown Hendersonville, with a great selection of restaurants. Hiking at Dupont State Forest was a great side trip, and the innkeeper gave great information about this spot. We would definitely return again.
reviews.title: Charming Inn, Excellent Service, Location & Value

reviews.text: The Waverly Inn is a very comfortable place to get away from it all. The rooms are beautiful. The innkeepers are gracious and the social hour is fun. Make sure to ask for John's special omlet for breakfast. Not to be missed.
reviews.title: A wonderful business trip and a romantic weekend retreat!

reviews.text: I will return time and again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed on various occasions and have always been made to feel at home and welcome. Now that we live closer, we will be regulars.
reviews.title: Better than home!!!

reviews.text: For almost 20 years we have enjoyed trips to the Waverly once or twice a year and we have never had a bad experience. We always attend one of the outstanding plays at nearby Flat Rock Playhouse and dine at one of several outstanding restaurants in Hendersonville. The innkeepers (John, Diane and Darla) are very accommodating to help with reservations, play tickets and have interesting stories and information about local lore. The Inn is not fancy but clean, well kept, comfortable, convenient and steeped in homey atmosphere. Guests are treated like family and old friends and are free to enjoy privacy or mingle with other guest as they desire. John's breakfasts are real feasts and worth the trip. For a leisurely, pleasant few days, you can't go wrong choosing The Waverly.
reviews.title: As Always A Real Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were informed by the Waverly "inn-sitter" (the hosts were away) during our previous stay that we had previously stayed seventeen times over the years. 'Nuff said, I suppose. We've stayed in b&bs from Texas to Maine, and I often wish I could send those innkeepers incognito to the Waverly for a couple of days just to experience from the customer's point of view how a great place can be run.
reviews.title: Our favorite B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Waverly Inn exactly 10 years ago and returned for our wedding anniversary. There is no establishment in all our world travels that offers more amenities that you'll actually avail yourself of. King-sized beds in B&B's, luxury bed linens, virtually any breakfast offering you can imagine, a proprieter who has led the local Chamber of Commerce, the Flat Rock Playhouse and most any other local civic organization you can think of, complimentary hi-speed Internet access for our laptop. If you can conceive it, John and Diane and Darla will deliver it!! Don't even think about a hotel or motel in Hendersonville. If your ultimate destination is Asheville, consider the Waverly Inn and drive. In Asheville, stay at the Biltmore Inn on Estate or the Grove Park Inn (and we've done both) but we'll wager that you will enjoy the Waverly even more. If you have any doubts, call John at the Inn and talk with him.
reviews.title: Ten years later it is even BETTER

likes.liked: — Amenities that were available and we used

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Waverly Inn has become our most favorite B&B in the States! John, Diane & Darla treat us like family on all our stays. John’s breakfasts and Darla’s chocolate chip cookies along with sitting on the wide porch each afternoon sipping wine and talking with the other guest are the highlights of our stays. Hendersonville has some of the best antiques shops to spend the day wandering around along with wonderful restaurants for a romantic evening with my wife.
reviews.title: What a wonderful place

reviews.text: We come home relaxed and rejuvenated and can’t wait until we can come back.

reviews.title: One of the best!
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Waverly Inn many times over the past 12 to 14 years. I must say that our recent stay was just as wonderful as our first. The staff there has always been wonderful and the breakfast is "a little slice of heaven". The french toast, the pancakes, and for a southerner like me, the grits are always something I look forward to. I think the two best things a person can say about an inn are, "I'll be back again" and "I will tell my friends how wonderful it is here". I have and continue to do both...

description: We welcome you to 1898 Waverly Inn where personal service sets us apart. Enjoy a full breakfast, cooked to order, evening tasting hour with light hors d'oeuvres, complimentary snacks, beverages and baked goods and help planning everything from hiking to dinner.
